title: PM Update: Cool with patchy fog tonight, then more beautiful weather Friday
text:
Puddle reflections on the Mall. (Erik Cox Photography/Flickr)

It was one fine fall day. About as good as is gets, really, with highs mainly in the 60s to near 70. Not only that, but we saw lots of sun and minimal wind. If you haven’t yet gotten enough, there’s more on the way tomorrow. And it’s also looking good for Game 3 tomorrow night.

Listen to our daily D.C. forecasts: Apple Podcasts | Amazon Echo | More options

Through tonight: Like last evening, temperatures dip quickly as the sun sets. Unlike last night, added moisture should keep temperatures from falling enough for any frost concerns. There could be patchy fog, though, especially near water or in valleys and after midnight. Lows range from the low 40s in the cool spots to the low 50s downtown.

View the current weather at The Washington Post.

Tomorrow (Friday): A south wind is pumping in slightly higher moisture at the ground and aloft. This means we should see increased cloudiness, compared with today, but plenty of sun. Highs aren’t far from where they ended up today, or mainly the upper 60s to around 70. The south wind blows around 5 mph.

An early look at Game 3 of the World Series shows partly cloudy skies, light winds and temperatures falling through the low and mid-60s around the start time, then toward 60 as the game goes on.

See Matt Rogers’s forecast through the beginning of next week. And if you haven’t already, join us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. For related traffic news, check out Gridlock.

Snow: It was a stunning start to the day across parts of Colorado, where 5 to 10 inches of snow fell in the foothills and mountains, with some areas picking up even more.

And snow has also been falling well south into the Texas Panhandle today, where thundersnow has been reported in and around Amarillo.
